name: Emerald Tree Monitor
description: Its bright green coloration is an adaptation to life in tree canopies.
food_note: Small vertebrates, insects, small reptiles, birds, and mammals
image_alt: Emerald tree monitor, photo: Prague Zoo archive
proportions: Length 75–100 cm, with the tail comprising at least 60%
reproduction: Females lay 1–5 eggs; incubation lasts 164–190 days.
attractions: It uses its prehensile tail to assist in climbing. It lives in small family groups consisting of a dominant male and several females. Females lay eggs in the nests of arboreal termites.
breeding: Breeding began in 1994, with the first offspring hatching just two years later in 1996.
